result.execSummary:
The defendant Lance M Dwyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution of $119.92 from file 14CF350 to be paid to Wal-Mart as a Condition of Probation. Court will not order restitution on 14CF291.
If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by the Agent.

No alcohol or drugs.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Lance M Dwyer in court, in custody, with attorney Ronald J. Sonderhouse.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following:
Ct. 1: 
- Total sentence: 3 1/2 years (Initial Confinement: 18 months - credit for 124 days;  Extended Supervision: 2 years)  Stayed for 2 years Probation
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $278.00 (includes DRGOD) to be paid as a Condition of Probation; alternate 6 days jail - consecutive
- Restitution of $119.92 from file 14CF350 to be paid to Walmart as a Condition of Probation
- Court will not order restitution on 14CF291
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation; alternate 5 days jail - consecutive
- Conditions of  Probation: Maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol/drugs.  Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by the Agent.   DNA Sample if not yet provided.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 17, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Lance M Dwyer in court, in custody, with attorney Ronald J. Sonderhouse.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests an adjournment to next week.  Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 17, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 10, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defense requests a plea date the second week in July. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 10, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
